primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters human history in the person of Jesus to bear the weight of human sin and sorrow through the Cross, thereby securing peace for an undeserving city/humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.
He is taking it with him as he begins his journey to Calvary.
the things that make for your peace
wrung out of God's inmost heart of yearning compassion
God paid it out of his vast storehouse of unconditional love
He weeps for those who will soon shout 'Crucify him!'
In other words, he weeps for us.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly told to identify as the Receiver/Sinner, not the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: the purpose of the Palm Sunday liturgy: for the church to know the things that make for [her] peace
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that 'remakes from the inside out'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Denial, and the 'Easy Easter' mentality
tekstueel_bewijs: the human tendency to flee as far away from the Cross as we possibly can
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a structural 'complicity in sin' that requires the death of the Son of God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to the visitation: attending Holy Week and bringing their burdens to the Cross.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (attending services/bearing the cross) is presented as a response to the primary program (Jesus' weeping and sacrifice).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God paid it out of his vast storehouse.
The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to make Easter easy.
The woman leaned forward and said...

voorbeelden: you will not want to miss the time of your visitation
we want to make Easter easy
she did not want to understand
Would that even today you knew
because you did not know the time of your visitation
unable to do anything to save them

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability to save) and God's 'pouvoir' (the finished work of the Cross).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Easy Easter' (Non-S1) to the reality of Sin/Judgment (S2), then to the resolution in the Cross (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Jesus absorbing S2 (Judgment) to provide S1 (Grace) as a free gift.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as 'iniquity' and 'hideous injustice' that causes God to weep.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the hearer as the one who shouts 'Crucify him' and God as the one who pays the price. Human action is a response, not a condition.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: learn of him to bear the cross

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Easter is free. It cost us nothing; it cost God everything.
The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (the crowd) are used as mirrors of our sin, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Jesus is the only active Subject of salvation.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and conviction; moving from self-righteousness to receiving mercy.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: the 'Fundamental Program' of God's sacrifice precedes and enables the 'Secondary Program' of the hearer's devotion.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: it is our sin that he bears away from us like the scapegoat

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological work; the Spirit's role in 'remaking' is mentioned but not developed.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is what kills the Messiah.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully places Jesus as the Subject of the primary narrative, avoiding the trap of making the hearer the hero of their own salvation.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'how' of the Spirit's work.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir-faire (Spirit's power) in the ethical section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Holy Spirit as the Helper who enables the 'bearing of the cross'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as sin and denial.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It refuses to let the hearer escape the 'Opponent' (Sin) while ensuring the 'Subject' (Jesus) does all the heavy lifting.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the moving imagery of tears, semiotics reveals that these tears are the 'modal competence' (willingness/pathos) of the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Luke's context; Greimas shows how the sermon functions as a 'delivery system' for the value of the Cross to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'woman at the door' is a failed Subject who tried to occupy the role of the 'Righteous' (S1) but was actually an 'Opponent' to the narrative of grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'tears' as a semiotic bridge between human suffering and divine redemption.
